Reviews.Title: Great Small Camera
Reviews.Author: Chris Parker "Chris"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after having my SD870 destroyed. This camera is a good improvement to an already good camera. I have a SLR and have used this as an additional camera. It is handy to have and produces photos that are vibrant and rival the SLR.The only thing that I dislike is the price. But they do pack a lot into this small device.Did I mention that it also does video? Not just a few short clips, but full video. It does not replace a camcorder, but it gives you a lot of options.cbp

Reviews.Title: Amazing deal for performance camera
Reviews.Author: Mohamed Fares "Mohamed Fares"
Reviews.Content: It's my first experience with Cannon in performance cams. I really was surprised regarding the quality of photos, colors and sharpness. The most amazing point for me with the image stablization. Whatever your move was or your sight move the picture comes out very stable and very sharp.I enjoy this camera very much.

Reviews.Title: Try to Pry it From My Hands!
Reviews.Author: S. Block
Reviews.Content: My first digital love was the Canon Digital Elph with two megapixels (2001).  I still used that camera and sold photos I shot with it.  Then it was stolen.  I was forced to replace it.  I chose the PowerShot SD990 IS, 14.7 megapixels, and it's PERFECT.  I really can't think of any annoying problems or drawbacks.  I love it for shooting videos.  I use Canon software, which I love, and transfer some videos to my mp3 player.  I find I use the camera a lot because I got a good little case for it.  It goes into my purse with no worries.  The battery life is excellent.  Recharging is fast.  You always need to upgrade the memory card with any new camera, since they rarely come with one large enough.  If anyone wants my beloved SD990IS, they will have to fight me for it!  BTW, I chose the silver case.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Susan Field
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It takes macro photos very well as well as quick shots of my active pets. I purchased it as an option to use when I don't want to lug a huge Canon SLR digital camera around with me. Most people are less intimidated by a small pocket sized camera for candid shots of themselves. I'm the M.O.B.(mother of the bride) for my daughter's wedding next June, 2010. I wanted something I could pull out for a quick candid shot or two.I first saw this camera in the Fall of 2008. I thought Canon would come out with a similar camera with more zoom. Alas, they did not. I waited and waited. Then, the price dropped and the new line of cameras came out, with not a one with anywhere near G-10 features. So, I purchased the 990SD and will have loads of fun learning all it's bells and whistles this Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: K. Zakar
Reviews.Content: I love the camera! It is so easy to use and the on off button which someone said was difficult is not a problem. The battery however does not last as long as the 4 AA's I used in my last cannon so I bought an extra battery so I always have one on hand. Problem solved.. I also have a problem with the coach bag. It is too small. I feel like the zipper is going to scratch my camera screen every time I put it in so I bought a bigger camera bag. Other then that I love the photos I have taken so far. Great Quality..

Reviews.Title: Canon 990is review
Reviews.Author: T. Keith
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying learning more about the camera on an everyday basis.  I do feel the camera is a bit overpriced, but overall I like the camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: M. E.
Reviews.Content: I am still getting use to very small size of this camera and using of all features properly. It's my first digital camera. The pictures I have made are so far brilliantly clear, colorwise very truthfull. I tried a portrait by candle light in otherwise dark room and came out great.The small size is very practical for having it anytime handy. I bought hard carry in case for better protection. I did not try taking any video, for that I am having HD camcorder. This one would serve just for immediate "emergency" situation. Battery was charged so far once, maybe a month ago and is still functioning well. I am testing how long it can stay charged.Camera is black, no need to spend more money for silver or gold. This price was the best, even better then Best Buys. Whoever buys, don't forget to set besides date also red eye reduction "on". The camera as I bought it had no setting and I was puzzled why I am getting horribly red eyes.Before I bought this camera I made study thru Internet what camera to buy and decided thanks to all reviews and features for this one.Only thing I am missing is more powerful zoom.

Reviews.Title: One Year Owner - Almost Perfect
Reviews.Author: Ching Vang "Chingy"
Reviews.Content: I have this camera for one whole year, so if anyone wants a accurate review, read on.After one year....- On/ off button kind of receded into the camera, like TV buttons that are over used, so I have to press it hard everytime, hopeing it'll turn on/ off. It usually takes me a few tries just to turn it on when the precious moment comes.- The audio just died yesterday. I was using a lot of flash at the park then I saw a powder of smoke come out of the microphone. Then I came home and the audio/ microphone doesn't work anymore. I can still hear it if I upload videos onto my computer and watch it, but play back audio in the camera doesn't work.- Scratches all over the camera. don't believe them when they say it's scratch resistant.- The viewfinder is useless. Not accurate and very small. The battery life is fine so you won't need to use a non accurate view finder.- Sand got into the zoom, so the zoom lever is stuck at times. Sometimes, it feels like there is super glue in the lever, so I have to manually push it back and fort a few times to unlock itself from the sand particles. It's annoying when I'm in the middle of a precious moment, only to find the zoom lever stuck.- Out of one whole year, I've only had one video that glitched on me, and a few glitched photos.- Video is out dated. 640 X 480, 30fps is very dated in this HD day and age. Plus you can only use digital zoom while in video, which results in blurry, aliasing horrible looking video. You can digital zoom first then take a video and it'll look much better than zooming while video, but it's still not optical zoom. Video at night sucks. Lots of noise in low light videos and it is weaker than your eyes. So you don't get what you can see in a real dark room. The video seems kind of choppy for 30 fps, maybe it's really 29 fps. You can edit, trim videos in the camera.- Picture quality was considered great a year ago. But there are newer canon compact models with better noise control for about the same price. ISO 80-200 is fine, but you can still see Canon's noise reduction even at these low ISO. ISO 400 is ok, but ISO 800-1600 is awful, full of blue and red noise so I never use them. The ISO 3200 was considered god a year ago, but now other canon models have better picture qualities for the same price. It was great when I first started shooting with it, but after I took a 20 minute long video, the camera burned up and the photos degraded since. So now there is noise reduction even at ISO 80. You can edit colors, trim pictures in the camera. Even has it's own slideshow (No audio).- very easy to use. Canon compacts beat every other brands because the buttons are a one touch wonder. A few touch can get you to macro, flash, color controls. Unlike other brands. Canon has the best controls and very easy to use.-Battery Life is very good compared to my old Canon SD790. Maybe because this camera only has a 2.5 screen while the SD790 had a 3.0 screen. But it'll last you a whole day at the park.- Focuses great for a compact. It does take a few seconds to focus in low light and not as accurately. Thank god it has manual focus (One of the first compacts to have it) because some macro shots just wont focus especially when there is to many leaves on screen or when the background and the subject are close together.- It has manual controls (The first compact ever to have Manual control) so I can catch jump shots and sports in daylight hours. But in the evening or on cloudy days, it it reminds me that it's still just a compact with manual controls. Now a days, Almost all Canon compacts come with Manual controls, so you can skip this camera if Manual control was all you wanted it for.- I-Contrast seems useful but it adds a lot of noise, and it highlights the whole picture, not just the dark subject. So If the foreground was dark and you used I-Contrast, it will lighten the foreground but also lighten the background. So you get a very bright, over exposed background for the cost. I never use it anymore because I can just lighten up the picture in photoshop or any other program, with more controls over the highlight.- Colors are so good and the camera gives you lots of color controls. Auto mode has no color controls, so the picture turns up kind of washed out and gray looking. But you can always add/ fix the colors in the camera. My colors beat all of my cousin's colors from his Sony, and Nikon compacts. You can edit the colors of the photo in the camera. Canon has alwaysbeen known for it's Vivid colors.Final Though : Almost perfect camera except for all of the negatives above. This camera was great because it was the first Canon compact to have Manual control/ focus, useable ISO 3200, and many other specs. But newer Canon compact models have it all plus better picture quality and HD videos, newer specs at about the same price (Still no optical zoom while in video). My advice is to look at all the newer Canon models first, because they have everything this camera has, plus better specs for the same price.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera but a bit pricey
Reviews.Author: Rosie
Reviews.Content: Nice camera ... takes great photos.  The wide angle leave a bit to be desired.  It is hardly a wide angle.  Other than that it is a nice compact camera.  It takes nice crisp and sharp pictures.  The camera gives you a lot of room to zoom in and crop a picture before printing it.  I recommend the Canon Leather carrying case for it as well.  It fits nice and snug in the hard case.  I literally throw it in the bottom of my brief case and have no problems with it.  Contrary to other reviews, my camera holds a nice charge!

Reviews.Title: Canon still leads in the compact camera arena
Reviews.Author: Charlie
Reviews.Content: As a long standing owner of Canon cameras over 30 years the company continues to make a variety of cameras that fill the needs of amateurs to professionals.  As a compact point and shoot, stylish camera with high resolution, bright large screen, and easy controls the SD900IS does a very good job.  The Nikon CoolPix cameras are the nearest competitors.  If you compare them side to side I feel Canon wins out. Go to a camera store and do a head to head comparison.  Canon has always had very good refresh rates between pictures, not taking long to write to the memory card. The rechargeable battery life is good. A spare battery is always a good idea to have on hand to switch out if needed.  The camera is not for professional shots and fast action sequences but it can handle 95% of the average users needs. Nice zoom range.  Great for faces and close ups.  The camera is for my daughter and she loves it.  Any teenager or adult looking for an easy to carry camera with very good quality images will enjoy the SD900IS.

Reviews.Title: Awesome !!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: R. PLAZOLA "Bobby Plazola"
Reviews.Content: The best camera I have ever owned.  This is my eighth digital camera, I have been purchasing only Canon cameras for the last four.The quality of pictures is amazing and that's not even the best part.  The HD video will blow you away!  Easy to use and the size issuch that you can put it in your pocket and take it anywhere, never miss another photo shoot opportunity.Five star all the way.

Reviews.Title: Best Value
Reviews.Author: Ethan's Mommy
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera for the birth of our son.  I LOVE it!  I'm still exploring all its features, but it is the best digital camera I've ever had.  The pictures are VERY good.  The price on amazon can't be beat! (Its $400 in the store) I do suggest getting a larger memory card for it though.  It comes with a 32 MB card (not enough!).  I found a cheap 4GB card on amazon which is more than enough memory.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: D. Thompson
Reviews.Content: I am impressed with this camera. I did alot of research before finally choosing this one and I'm very happy with my choice. It's easy to use and takes fantastic pictures. Probably the best photos I've ever seen and I worked in a photo printing lab for a year so I've seen alot of pictures. It is definetely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Small wonder
Reviews.Author: Nonni4hlk
Reviews.Content: Replacing my old Canon with a new Canon was quite an undertaking of sorts. I researched and researched via various websites and finally chose the SD990. My requirements are simple...point...shoot...print and for not a ton of money! I am not one to read instructions to any great length and with this camera I really didn't need to as it is very user-friendly. The software is great...downloads are easy and there are many ways to alter the photo so that the finished print looks great. The camera is so good that it enables you to take a photo of something moving (slowly), like an animal in the zoo, without the end result being blurry. The zoom is wonderful. The large screen is fantastic. The only con I have and I can absolutely live with it is the on/off button. It requires using my thumbnail pressed into it to turn it on. Using the pad of my finger doesn't get it done, however, I'm so used to it now that it is no longer a problem. Also, the design of the camera is very sleek and can sometimes feel a bit slippery in your hand so I just use the strap each time I go to take a photo which insures the safety & well-being of the camera...I can be clutsy at times :) I would recommend this camera to anyone who wants a point 'n' shoot camera that's easy to use and that produces great photos for not a ton of money.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SD990IS
Reviews.Author: Joshua Berkowitz "Kid-O"
Reviews.Content: This is my third Powershot camera.  Most recently, I replaced my lost SD800 with the 990.  The pictures are superior to those I've seen taken by other digital cameras (and that's not because I'm the one taking them).  The new modes are fun and useful, like the manual mode that allows you to control shutter speed and aperture, and the 3200 setting that allows you to take pictures without a flash in low light. I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: A+
Reviews.Author: iamGODrU
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great camera. Easy to use for amateur as well as professional shooter. Picture clarity and image stabilization is also great.Cons: Price could be a little better, power button is small for big hands and fingersOverall, this camera is fun to use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This Canon PowerShot does it all... I like it for its convenience without having to lug around a big dslr camera.  It has image stabilization and it provides the photography enthusiast with a camera that can be used easily on auto mode or more professionally on a variety of other modes.

Reviews.Title: Perfect For Me!
Reviews.Author: Royce E. Rahn
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera.  The camera offers many different settings!  I went snowboarding in Mammoth this weekend and set the camera to "SNOW" and the pictures came out so clear.  I have had a couple pictures come out a little blurry because I sometimes have shaky hands; however it's a huge improvement to my previous canon powershot camera.  Also, if you're looking for a case for the camera I ordered the following case and the camera fits perfect:http://www.amazon.com/3n1-Combo-Kit-Neoprene-Powershot/dp/B001F0WT9O/ref=sr_1_44?ie=UTF8&s;=apparel&qid;=1234198419&sr;=8-44I thought when ordering this camera the battery was the same as my old powershot and it's not.  So rather than using my old battery I had to buy a new one.  I like to have a backup battery just in case my battery goes dead.  So I purchased this equivalent battery that is not the actual "Cannon" battery but much cheaper:http://www.amazon.com/Ultralast-UL-NB4L-Li-Ion-Battery-Equivalent/dp/B000K2NWYE/ref=pd_cp_cps_3?pf_rd_p=413863801&pf;_rd_s=center-41&pf;_rd_t=201&pf;_rd_i=B000KNJEX6&pf;_rd_m=ATVPDKIKX0DER&pf;_rd_r=0T0SZ511GGG9GFBM9DFRThe one thing on this camera that looks like it might break easily is the Memory & Battery cover.  It's plastic so I make sure I am extra careful opening it to remove the battery and/or memory stick.

Reviews.Title: Works in all settings tested
Reviews.Author: Willie
Reviews.Content: This camera is fast and accurate. It has easy navigate menus, including control over settings for those who desire.  Choose the correct setting and the pictures are awesome in low light through wicked bright light.  Action quick shots, indoor portraits, outdoor scenery all awesome.  Face recognition software just plain works every time and quickly.  Canon reportedly upgraded this and I believe it based on seeing it in action.  Image stabilization works without noticeable slowdown.  A nice plus is this may be the only new camera with a plain view port for those quick shots you don't have time to check the LCD screen (like when my son was climbing and snapped some shots).  You can easily edit shots in the camera if you don't want to wait for downloads.  The case is strong.  The battery seems to last a long time.  We haven't been able to find a negative for the camera.  The associated warranty extension is another matter....

Reviews.Title: One of the best cameras in its class
Reviews.Author: MO. Bari "Mo"
Reviews.Content: After much research I bought this camera and I couldn't be happier with my purchase. I use it almost every day and take it with me where ever I go. Excellent battery life, picture quality and features.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: L. Yeash "Mother Earth"
Reviews.Content: Consumer Reports Magazine consistently ranks Canon cameras as the best so they are the only ones I consider.  This camera has a rapid fire shutter feature that allows you to take pictures in rapid succession so if a parade is going by or your child is performing in an event, you don't miss a shot waiting for the battery or camera to recharge.  It is very simple for the average person to use but if you want more manual control and less automatic, you can do that.  I don't know what all the features mean to do it manually but I could if I read the simple to understand instruction manual.  My only criticism is the camera is not ergonomic to hold so I always put on my wrist strap and not worry about dropping it.  I would highly recommend this camera to anyone, it is amazing in every respect.

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Martin "online shopper"
Reviews.Content: Great product.  I was totally pleased with my Canon camera.  I have two new babies in the family and I'm able to capture crystal clear moments and have the memories to cherish.  My last digital camera was a disappointment because many images captured were blurry.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the extra money in my opinion
Reviews.Author: Amazon Addict
Reviews.Content: I had the SD1100IS Canon PowerShot SD1100IS 8MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Blue) and decided I was going to upgrade to the SD990IS because I liked the look of the all black camera better and it was supposed to be a better all around camera.I used it for one day and found that for a point and shoot camera the 990IS is not better than the 1100IS. My 1100IS would take clear in focus pictures every single time. The 990IS I had a lot of pictures that were out of focus. When you are out on the town and just snapping pictures as the night goes on you don't really take time to review them all until you come home and I found that maybe 1 out of 6 pictures were out of focus. This is unacceptable to me when I have paid more for a camera that doesn't perform as well.  I am going to return this camera and get the SD1200IS Canon PowerShot SD1200IS 10 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Dark Gray)as it is the next gen of the SD1100IS. Check out that page to get my review of it. I already have a review of the 1100.

Reviews.Title: I guess I was expecting a little more...
Reviews.Author: CC777 "ccz777"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from SD-450 to this camera.  I guess my expectations were high.  So, far my photos are good but not better than the 450 as far as the clarity.  My biggest issue with this camera is that my photos are soft (not sharp) indoors.  In good lighting, they are amazing.  Also, I wish the LCD viewer was a larger.With that said, I love the face recognition with the zoom feature and "quick shot" feature that makes this camera work similar to an SLR.  The video is very clear. I have only used the camera about 8 times so I will update this review upon further examination.

Reviews.Title: This camera only cost $399.00 brand new
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Yane
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera new shortly after canon released it.  I paid only $399.00 for it along with all the trimmings from Canon's website.  This camera is no longer available.  How can one justify asking such a ridiculous price?  I love the camera, but please!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Watch for red and yellow eye
Reviews.Author: wyldwrh
Reviews.Content: This camera would be great if you could take a picture of someone without the dreaded demon eye or red eye.  It also does very poorly in low light. Outside it does a great job with vivid pictures that are quite impressive.  If only it would work better in low light and indoors.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error, Restart Camera problem
Reviews.Author: L33.T "L33.T"
Reviews.Content: I bought this Canon SD990IS on Amazon 3/2009. Its now 11/2009 and i'm receiving the infamous "Lens Error, Restart Camera" error (search online and you will find tons of people with this issue on lots of Canon cameras) when I try to turn my camera on. I always have it in my fully padded case and I have never gone to the beach with it (so no sand inside). The camera clicks and beeps and then displays the error, and then it shuts right off. I have just requested for a free repair and I am going to send it in. I hope I will not get charged for this repair! I will update this and see if Canon warranty really does suck like how most people say they do.. and if they will charge me for this repair, even though i'm only 7 months into this warranty. Crosses fingers! I hope they fix this camera for free because it was a nice camera!

Reviews.Title: a multitude of modes to learn
Reviews.Author: ernster
Reviews.Content: i was in the market for a new camera to replace an aging sony cybershot from 2001.  while searching through various brands, i came upon the lesser brother of this elph at best buy.  the odd thing was that it was missing many features that this camera provides and was only 20 dollars cheaper.the camera has many modes to learn:  you can splice shots together, you can concentrate on a particular color in the landscape to accentuate, and the picture quality is excellent for a point and shoot.  the macro shots are crisp, and the auto features make this easy for newbie camera operators like myself to take great pictures.i was disappointed in the movie mode in as much as the other cheaper canon models had high definition movie capability that this one appears to lack.it's small enough to palm, and the contruction is sturdy and doesn't feel like it's going to fall apart after using outdoors day in and day out.

Reviews.Title: Excellent overall
Reviews.Author: Hellau
Reviews.Content: Pricey photo camera, but very nice. I took close up of moving animals, and they came out with a quality of professional shots! This camera is very good all around.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Allen Chen
Reviews.Content: This camera is great! It takes great pictures and it has all these different features such as foliage, waterfalls, or night options that allow for taking even better pictures! I recommend this camera to everyone!

Reviews.Title: An excellent camera, but "manual" mode is misrepresented
Reviews.Author: Kimboi
Reviews.Content: I had a SD790 that impressed me greatly: terrific image quality and many useful features. However I discovered that I had frequent trouble composing my images using the screen and I wanted more control over the image (motion control, depth of field). So I returned it and got the SD790 after doing a lot of research (but not enough, apparently). The "manual" mode only gives you the choice of two aperture settings! You can pick any shutter speed you want, but obviously only the one corresponding to the selected aperture will give you the correct exposure. Maybe that's not important to you, but it was to me -- very much. I'd probably have bought a different camera (or not bothered to return the 790) had I realized this. I feel that Canon's description of this mode as "manual" is misleading and deceptive, it may constitute false advertising.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Marlyn Ampueda
Reviews.Content: I've just started in this hobby: taking pictures, and I bought this camera without knowing most of its fuctions, but in the past 2 months I've realized that Canon SD990 IS it's a great camera, the face detection works great, and the image stabilization plus quick shot works great for those who wants to take pics of their own pets or other animals or people in sports (like me). I also owned but lost the Canon A720 IS, great camera too but too big. Negative: takes a wide long from pic to pic when you are using the flash in a very dark places and the videos are not compatibles whith Window Media Player. For those who know the technichals details I apologize because this is not the right way to describe a product, and for those who wants a great camera for great price buy this one.

Reviews.Title: super Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: CoDy
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for a month now and have not found anything wrong with it.  It takes amazing pictures.  Probably one of the best features it has is the Manual/Program mode. I can take quality photos without paying the price for a big digital SLR.  I also enjoy that it is small enough for me to take wherever I go.  I highly recommend this camera to anyone.  Good for the beginner clear up to the more advanced photographer.

Reviews.Title: Another nice canon product
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: This canon camera is a real nice point and shoot with an easy to use GUI and it didn't take me long to start getting some real nice pictures. You cant go wrong with this camera if your looking for probably the best camera right now that you can carry on you at all times. There is only one thing I have noticed though, and im not sure if it has been there all along but there is a dead/stuck pixel near the center of the screen, but its only there when you are viewing on the lcd screen, once I push the take button down halfway to focus it, it goes away. Not sure if its normal or not, but it doesn't affect its usage and doesn't show up in pictures and I see no reason to return it, I'm not that picky. Overall I recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: Great Gift!
Reviews.Author: Christian P. Santos
Reviews.Content: Received this product as a gift from my girlfriend, I reallt love this camera, its easy to use and the quality of the pictures are great.

Reviews.Title: Sold it after 3 months.
Reviews.Author: Johnny Lightning "Driver"
Reviews.Content: I am a Canon guy.  I love most of Canon's cameras.  I purchased this SD990IS to replace my SD660 that was dropped and broken.  I was very excited about this camera when I ordered it from Amazon.  I thought it would be the end all beat all point and shoot camera.  First I did not like the build quality.  It feels like a plastic toy Sponge Bob camera.  When you push on the power button it feels like it is going to break.  I would have never purchased it if I would have seen one in person before.  Second big drawback is the slow shutter speed.  I though that I could get over it but after missing the shot time and time again I had to get rid of this camera.  It took close to a second to snap off the shot.  On the plus side the low light pictures were great.  Also the ability to zoom in on a 14.7MP picture will blow your mind.  It takes GREAT pictures.  Its just slow.

Reviews.Title: Useless battery!
Reviews.Author: Love 2 Bake
Reviews.Content: Don't do it!  Just don't!  Frequently, within moments of installing the freshly charged battery, I get a message telling me to change the battery pack.  What?!?  Then at other times it would act fine, so I'd think this camera was okay after all.  Then it would happen again--I could never tell when--and I'd lose pictures because of this ridiculous battery!  I bought a second battery as a back up, hoping against hope that this camera was salvageable.  No difference!  I'm sending this entire piece of garbage back.

Reviews.Title: Cannon fans: first time Cannon disappointed me =(
Reviews.Author: Regular working mom
Reviews.Content: Extremely hard to control the quality of this camera.(or I should say very difficult to get the functions correct)  Sometime I get very good quality other time I get really bad quality (NOT because I shake the camera!) eventhough I have adjust it to "auto"...  seem like you have to manually adjust it to the correct scene inorder to get good quality of pictures...  I got this camera for over 3 years and I still couldn't get it correct...  The video quality is not good either unless you don't zoom it.

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Super-Zoom!
Reviews.Author: TL in AZ
Reviews.Content: Ok, so you're looking for a compact super-zoom camera and scoured the 'net reading all the reviews about how the Panasonic Lumix ZS-3 beats the Canon SX200IS. Well, let me tell you, the SX200IS is a far more enjoyable camera to use. I initially purchased a ZS-3 and found it lacking in the "fun-to-use" category and overall picture quality.First, a caveat: I've owned multiple Canon point-and-shoots, so I'm very comfortable with the user interface and most importantly, I like how the Canon DIGiC chips process the images. So, yes, I'm a bit biased, but I went ahead and tried the Lumix ZS-3 anyway based on its many positive reviews.My disappointments with the Lumix ZS-3 were the following:-Loose (or at the least, less solid feeling than the SX200IS) mode selector wheel.-Grainy looking pics even at the lowest ISOs-Flat looking colors-Less-intuitive menu system-Doesn't feel as substantive in your handI ultimately exchanged it for the Canon SX200IS and couldn't be more pleased...Here's why:-User-friendlier menu system-Full manual controls-Really easy to adjust exposure, ISO, and flash power-Smooth two-speed zoom motor-Better image processing (richer colors at default settings)-Good movie recording (remember, no optical zoom though)-Solid build quality (feels just right in your hand)Some other thoughts:It takes a few days to get used to the pop-up flash. One time I had my finger on the flash cover (which lays flat when the flash is deployed) while shutting down the camera. The lens retracted, but flash stayed put until I lifted my finger and allowed the motor/spring-loaded mechanism to pull the flash inside. Just remember keep you finger away from the cover when turning the camera on/off.Pick up a screen protector from Clarivue ([...]) to protect the 3" LCD from fingerprints and scratches.All-in-all, this is a terrific camera for someone who wants a compact camera to take along on trips, to capture spontaneous family memories and to have fun while taking pics and learning digital photography. I enjoy using it even more than my Nikon D40.Good luck in your search for a compact super-zoom and remember to keep expectations realistic; Compacts can't rival the picture quality of DSLRs, but cameras like the Canon SX200IS make picture-taking a joy.

Reviews.Title: CANON POWERSHOT IS A POWERSHOT.
Reviews.Author: AVATAR VINCE
Reviews.Content: AMAZING PRODUCT!I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT.I AM A PROFESSIONAL VIDEOGRAPHER AND WANTED A CAMERA THAT WAS EASY TO USE AS A POINT AND SHOOT.

Reviews.Title: A great camera
Reviews.Author: Web Warrior
Reviews.Content: I selected this camera after spending hours reading many, many reviews on [...], [...] and here on Amazon.  It is a tremendous camera and is galaxies better than my old Kodak LS443.  I especially like the fact it has a viewfinder, not something mentioned by very many reviewers.  It does everything well.  It is easy to use.  My only minor complaints and they are that, very minor is I wish it was just a bit bigger because I'm a large guy with big hands.  Also have to be careful not to cover up the flash holding it but that's easy to teach yourself to overcome.  Finally, I would have exchanged some of the very small size for just a little more wide angle and telephoto lens capability.  Considering the size of the camera this does a commendable job.  This is the only digital point and shoot to get great reviews by [...], [...] and Amazon.  The three complaints I read on Amazon reflect a lack of understanding rather than honest criticism of this great Canon camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Christopher Rennick
Reviews.Content: I am completely satisfied with this camera.  I read many reviews of many cameras and decided on this camera for image quality and ease of use.  The negative reviews must be due to operator error or some anomalous defects as I have not experienced any problems that were not of my own doing.  I have really enjoyed doing close up photos of plants and sea shells.  The manual focus capability has really made it possible to get truly sharp, high resolution images for later manipulation.  I do most of my shooting in fairly bright light so the ISO has been low and noise in the pictures is practically non-existent.  When I see what this camera can do with fairly miniscule optics, it makes me wonder what life would be like with a EOS 5D mk 2 with an L series lens.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SD 9901S 1407 MP
Reviews.Author: Jeanette Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Really good pictures.  I would like more user friendly and better direction in instruction book, but great pictures make up for it.

Reviews.Title: Canon camera
Reviews.Author: Tommy H. Beard ""Top Gun""
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera. Great size to take anywhere. Took it to SeaWorld yesterday and it was handy and useful.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Rose Graham
Reviews.Content: I found this camera to be a really nice one.  However I bought it for the reason, I understood, it was great for closeups.  I used the micro but was a little bit disappointed in the picture quality.  I have another Canon that I use and it was better than this one.  I gave this one to a friend and he loves it.  He has been able to take really nice pictures and it is so easy to use.  So there you have it.  I would recommend buying this camera, but not for really close closeups.

Reviews.Title: How easy to get great pictures
Reviews.Author: L. Collins "sidewinder"
Reviews.Content: Been looking for a good quality point shoot camera and I have found it in the Canon SD990IS. Got rid of my Pentax Program 35mm and very seldom even use my Minolta diamage camera anymore because it is so much easier to carry the pocket size SD990IS which takes as good pictures as my pervious cameras. Now I am seldom without my camera so when the old " I wish I had the camera " moment comes along I get the shot now. Used this for my son's recent wedding and was plesently supprised with the quality pictures and only my poor composure tecnique caused some pictures that weren't keepers.

Reviews.Title: Totally diggin' it!
Reviews.Author: R. Jewell "boysmommy"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes better pictures than the $1000+ Nikon my husband bought me 2 years ago.  I bought so I could have something to throw in my purse and it has been fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Cannon Powershoot Products
Reviews.Content: The camera have good resolution and great new features but you have to read the manual to get the resolution you want. The only bad thing is older models have a safe lock in the battery and memory stick cover and this model not.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!
Reviews.Author: C. Delong
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I just sold my DSLR because I wanted something smaller but something that took great photos and this is it.  The video is amazing too.  I was on a job taking video and photos of a dam repair and the video I produced had amazing quality.  If you are looking for a point and shoot and can afford it I would definitely recommend this one.  Everyone I've shown the photos too loves it and can't believe I only paid 299!

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Michelle Fitzenhagen "picky picture taker"
Reviews.Content: Good camera - great pictures;  I am looking for a camera that takes pictures quickly.  This has that feature but you cannot use the video screen; you have to look through a tiny view finder.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SD990IS 14.7MP Digital Camera with 3.7x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom
Reviews.Author: Garnet Ambrose
Reviews.Content: The Canon Powershot SD990IS 14.7MP Digital Camera with 3.7x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom is the best little camera I've used yet. From micro pictures to large landscape shoots this Camera is the best bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Jason T
Reviews.Content: This camera is very good. It takes very good pictures and has good battery life. The only downside about it is its a little bigger than i thought it would be, but overall it is a great camera

Reviews.Title: excellent purchase
Reviews.Author: Tricolor
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera and very easy to carry.The best review I can write is that a I have the same camera and I bought a new one for my daughter.Easy to use and as I bought the underwater case it takes wonderful underwater pictures.Great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Sierra Hiker
Reviews.Author: Mark Brenner "sierra Hiker"
Reviews.Content: Canon Powershot SD990IS 14.7MP Digital Camera with 3.7x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Black)We bought this camera to replace a Canon A640.  The Photos are wonderfully sharp, excellent color and contrast.  It is perfect for both macro photography along with outstanding scenic shots.  Nice size to slip in a pocket.  We bought the Caselogic UNZ-2 Small Universal Pocket - perfect for a simple case but not room for a spear battery or extra memory card.

Reviews.Title: Cannon Powershot SD990 IS
Reviews.Author: C. Faile
Reviews.Content: Excellent product,  Preforms admirably in any condition and light setting.  Offers all the options and adjustments most would ever want, and will work as a great point& shoot at the same time

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Fred B. Clark
Reviews.Content: I've used it for a month and couldn't be happier!!! Fred

Reviews.Title: first shot delay

Reviews.Content: This camera works well while the light is bright. When the light is not so good, the pictures blur. Although the flash light solves the blur problem, it is so strong that the pictures look unnatural.

Reviews.Title: Camera lens fails to retract
Reviews.Author: road trip reader
Reviews.Content: Purchased to take on trip to australia resolution seemed good after 900 photos camera suddenly stopped working.changed batteries& that wasnt the problem. For first 3 weeks it was terrific;tho noticed it did not seem as tightly sealed on sides as my previous canon elph. Reviews.Title: Excellent Elph Powershot
Reviews.Author: CoexistCapeCod "CapeCodCoexist"
Reviews.Content: This is my fifth or sixth Canon Elph Powershot and I love it. I actually bought it when it first came out and sold it when I bought a G10 (another great camera). I love the G10 - but it is bulky and I wasn't grabbing it every time I went out - like I did with my SD990.....so I bought another one! Now I have 2 cameras that I love - both do or have something that the other doesn't so I will be a 2 camera guy. I love the cropping ability of the SD990. Picture quality is excellent. The only thing I wish it had was either a wider lens or a longer zoom. Aside from that it is perfect for me! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SD990IS 14.7MP Digital Camera with 3.7x Optical Image Stabilized
Reviews.Author: Carl E. Brown "cbsports1"
Reviews.Content: Canon Powershot SD990IS 14.7MP Digital Camera with 3.7x Optical Image Stabilized  GREAT CAMERA

Reviews.Title: Delievered as promised
Reviews.Author: Jason Wang "Jason"
Reviews.Content: Great camera and the vendor delivered as promised, quick shipping, and great product. Would recommend...

Reviews.Title: great compact camera
Reviews.Author: L. Douglass
Reviews.Content: I recieved my camera 2 days after ordering it using the free shipping.  I am not a camera buff but it takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: 2 words
Reviews.Author: Steve Arnold
Reviews.Content: I have only Two words that explains my review. Great Camera Great Price.....oops that was 4 words.

Reviews.Title: A GREAT POINT AND SHOOT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: JIMBUNKUS "JIMMY D"
Reviews.Content: IT HAS TO BE THE BEST AND MOST ADVANCED POINT AND SHOOT CAMERA ON THE MARKET TODAY!!  BEAUTIFUL PICTURES BETTER THAN I COULD IMAGINE, THE AUTOMATIC FUNCTIONS ARE REALLY GREAT AND IS SOMETHING YOU CAN EAISLY USE AND APPRECIATE ESPECIALLY FOR QUICK POINT AND SHOOT PHOTOGRAPHY. Reviews.Title: outstanding DC!!

If include wide-angle, that will be wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: Not bad but poor picture quality if you don't hold the camera really still.
Reviews.Author: SMW "SWOLFE3074"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bought this camera a month ago and took it with us on our trip to Cancun.  It takes great still pictures but when it comes to people and faces, well it comes off a bit short.  We took over 800 pictures in 8 days and most of the pictures with people were a bit unclear.  They were not as crisp as our pictures of scenery and FOOD :)Another thing we did not like about this camera is you really need to know how to use it to get a decent picture.  When we would pass the camera to a stranger or friend to take our picture, because they figure it is just a point and shoot, they snap the picture without doing any auto focusing and leave us with a not so great picture and a lost opportunity to save memories.  This is with the auto setting mind you in good light.All in all once you know how to use the camera it takes pretty good pictures.  The auto setting in low light does not select the correct ISO for the brightness so most pictures in a low light area under the auto setting come out too dark. For better pictures in low light you have to use the P/M setting but you also have to act as if you are a tripod and remain very still otherwise the picture will be blurry.I have just returned this camera to Amazon and am looking for a new one.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!

Reviews.Content: Awesome camera! I haven't played around with everything yet, but it is an awesome camera.  A little pricey.  I would wait until the price comes down first.

Reviews.Title: HD quality
Reviews.Author: Miguel Fuentes "COUNTRY BOY"
Reviews.Content: The digital pictures are excellent, near HD quality. The numerous pictures format that can be taken are nice. The only drawback I had was reading the instruction manual the size of a small novel.

Reviews.Title: "Lens error - resart camera"

Reviews.Title: Good enough for the price

Reviews.Title: surper

Reviews.Content: amazon  price is usually cheap compared to local stores/ as always. fast and liable dealer. this prod is broght for some else to use. but just looking at it, it is somethig to satisfy most to the picturings

Reviews.Title: I got it cheaper @ buydig.com

Reviews.Title: rattle inside new Canon Powershot SD 990
Reviews.Author: A. Krivenyshev
Reviews.Content: Few minutes ago- just got my new Canon Powershot SD 990 IS and as you are taking Camera out of the shipping box- you can hear slight rattle inside camera- loose lens, loose protective cover or loose shutter rattle ???If you shake the camera gently, you can hear a rattle sound inside.Very disappointing with Canon- as my recent Canon Video GL2 ZOOM stop working (cable inside broke- cut off -presumably by tape door cover and Canon Image Stabilizer Lense EF-S 17-85 for EOS20 stop working also - with Error 99.
